Heaven is not at fault; it is people who bring this upon themselves. Do you now grasp this more deeply?

Indeed, indeed!

Proceed. You have awakened. The laws of Heaven do not favor the familiar on a whim; it is the foolish who recklessly provoke them. If I have not explained sufficiently, what then is the greatest grievance?

The greatest grievance is the great worthy. From youth, they study goodness, follow virtue, and possess true Dao and power. They should become the emperor’s assistants, aiding in the governance of yin and yang. If the emperor obtains such a one, he may embrace them with joy, ruling effortlessly and without care. But if such a person is obstructed and blocked, their true Dao and power persisting until old age and death, this is a grievous sorrow. Yet if the emperor fails to secure such great worthies and instead governs with the foolish, yin and yang fall into chaos, myriad calamities arise, and he toils day and night in suffering, consumed by great sorrow. This too is a profound grievance, a cause for deep lament.

Thus, the sages of antiquity, wise and far-reaching, ensured that all worthies emerged and gathered to assist above. Therefore, neither side suffered grievance. Heaven and Earth, too, were governed by them, free from affliction and sorrow—how much more so for humanity? Do you, Perfected One, understand?

Indeed, indeed!

Excellent are the words of the Heavenly Master! In what way are they excellent?

This is what Heaven attains: the resolution of suffering and hardship. What the emperor attains: effortless rule without care. What the worthy attain: the full expression of their loyalty and sincerity, aiding their lord in governance, exhausting their abilities to diligently resolve the great concerns of Heaven and Earth. The myriad beings of the world also benefit and flourish. Thus, it is called excellent.

Excellent are the words of the Perfected One; I have nothing to add.

Therefore, all that people may seek to accomplish will not result in grievance if they attain it through their own conduct. What they seek but do not obtain becomes a great grievance. Now, if one seeks death, they obtain death; if one seeks evil, they obtain evil; if one seeks goodness, they obtain goodness. Heaven follows their heart—this is great fortune, for what is sought is attained. If one deliberately places themselves in mortal peril, making death pacts, they will indeed die. If one daily seeks misfortune, they will meet with evil and perish—this too is the case. In all false and mundane affairs, what one seeks is granted by Heaven and Earth; nothing is more grievous than this for such a person. Has the Perfected One also fully awakened to this?

Indeed, indeed!

Proceed. You have awakened. Now, I wish to thoroughly explain this for your benefit.

I have already outlined the main principles for you. Reflect on their meaning and present them to the virtuous ruler of the highest Dao, showing them to all worthies. Let each exert effort in their pursuits. If they seek but do not obtain, it is because their sincerity is not yet complete.

Heaven and Earth are like an echo and shadow—they do not deceive. It is the foolish who deceive themselves, belittling and neglecting their own lives. The greatest fault lies here. The multitude of fools together disrupt Heaven and Earth, not merely bringing sorrow upon themselves. Their transgressions are such that Heaven is deeply grieved.

The foolish bring this upon themselves, yet when they fall into destitution, they turn and wail to Heaven and Earth. Over time, this deeply troubles Heaven and Earth with sorrow. Thus, I have been sent down to fully explain and resolve the intentions of the world’s people, so that all worthies may clearly deliberate on my words. My words are the discourse of Heaven and Earth. I do not idly speak of these matters with the Perfected One; I convey the teachings and commands of Heaven. Let each recognize the source of their own faults and no longer blame one another.

Therefore, I have spoken exhaustively. I dare not speak falsely. The reason I have spoken so thoroughly is that I alone understand the intentions of Heaven and Earth. Thus, I was sent down to discuss the world’s affairs with the Perfected One, distinguishing right from wrong, so that the virtuous ruler and the worthies may all reflect upon them. Let this be transmitted for ten thousand generations. May later generations chant and recite it as a constant law, never forgetting it.

Thus, whenever I see the Perfected One inquire about matters, I am always glad to resolve Heaven’s concerns, and each resolution eases its sorrow. Whenever I witness Heaven’s words, I immediately align with the intentions of Heaven and Earth, explaining and expounding them without the slightest negligence. If you have doubts, come again to discuss them. Since I have been entrusted with this mission and sent down to speak, I truly stand in awe of Heaven’s majesty and spare no effort.

Do you now clearly understand?

Indeed, indeed!

Proceed. You have grasped the intentions of Heaven and Earth and should understand the affairs of life.

People accumulate folly, failing to early study the true Dao, virtuous power, and extraordinary methods, dismissing them as trivial. They do not realize that their faults accumulate and disrupt Heaven and Earth, bringing sorrow to their emperor. Their lives are cut short by Heaven, and they do not live out their allotted years. Perfected One, ponder deeply my words. Is there any greater fault in the world than this death?

Excellent, excellent! The foolish have now greatly awakened. If you awaken early, you may be called one who understands the affairs of life, avoiding misfortune and drawing near to good fortune.

Awakening yet not ceasing—is the true Dao then complete?

To gain a king or marquis in a single day—is this not inferior to gaining an immortal?

Now, encountering gold worth a thousand *jin* or jade discs by the myriad—is this not inferior to gaining an enlightened teacher?

An emperor may have countless foolish ministers—is this not inferior to gaining one greatly worthy and wise?

Parents may bear a hundred unworthy sons—is this not inferior to bearing one son who is worthy?

In a village of a hundred households, none study—is this not inferior to drawing near one of great virtue?

Ten thousand eyes strain in confusion—is this not inferior to grasping one great principle?

All under Heaven teems with chaos, possessing everything—is this not inferior to Heaven alone, divine and sagely, riding *qi* to soar and roam?

Though the myriad things are abundant—are they not inferior to the single *qi* that alone enlivens humanity?

Thus, I now command the Perfected One among learners: swiftly cast aside superficial flourishes, devote yourself to essential matters, and seek the true Dao.

Do you desire supreme fortune? Then truly emulate Heaven.

Heaven and Earth, free of affliction, rejoice eternally—does the true Dao, with its wondrous and extraordinary methods, not emerge to protect humanity?

Therefore, the sages of antiquity constantly emulated Heaven and dared not slacken; thus, they alone were perpetually fortunate.

When worthy scholars gather their strategies, the Dao of Heaven is complete.

Each speaks one good word, and yin and yang are ordered; the divine spirits rejoice.

Disasters and harms all lie subdued, never to arise again.

This is called governing in accord with Heaven’s heart, and baneful ministers are eradicated.

How divine is the Dao! It is the art of spontaneity.

Excellent, excellent! Foolish students formerly did not diligently inquire and thus had no means to know this.

Yet your words are correct.

If one studies yet does not diligently inquire, how can one make daily progress?

If one walks yet does not frequently move one’s feet, how can the Way be attained?

If one studies yet does not gain an enlightened teacher, how can knowledge be brought to fruition?

If one governs a state and desires joy and peace, yet does not employ the greatly worthy, how can order be achieved in a single day?

Excellent are the Celestial Master’s words!

Yet you have now glimpsed their subtle meaning.

Thus, a city of gold with ninefold walls is not equal to serving one greatly worthy.

Therefore, the sages and worthies of antiquity all served enlightened teachers to resolve their cares and troubles.

Thus, sages and worthies all had teachers and methods.

Perfected One, take heed: in all matters, cherish yourself. The gates of fortune and misfortune may be perceived.

Indeed, indeed!

Admonish the Perfected One with one word.

Indeed, indeed!

What people seek and obtain, Heaven grants in accord with their seeking, never failing them. Do not wait until death’s approach to weep to Heaven and wail to Earth.

This is called seeking and obtaining for oneself, then turning to blame Heaven and Earth—this is called a person of great rebellion. Heaven does not favor them; Earth does not delight in them; ghosts and spirits will not protect them.

Those who suffer injustice alone bear their injustice; those who seek yet do not obtain, do so in vain.

All things each obtain what they seek—why bring injustice upon oneself?

Perfected One, ponder deeply my words: are they true or not?

My writings do not err; even in ten thousand words, not one is amiss.

Yet today, Heaven detests and swiftly punishes such errors, so I repeatedly expound upon them. Though I have spoken above, I again admonish the Perfected One below.

Thus, I deliberately cause these words to be repeated and rejoiced in, so that people of later ages may ponder them deeply, cherish them, transmit them, copy them, and show them to one another without concealing them.

Heaven’s admonitory scriptures delight in being promulgated and do not wish to be hidden.

Indeed, indeed!

Proceed.

To the right is compiled a collection on whether the deceased encounter injustice, whether their desires are fulfilled or not, whether the state’s safety or peril aligns with their learning, and whether they meet an enlightened teacher or an unworthy one.

*Tai Ping Jing*, Scroll 90 concludes
*Tai Ping Jing*, Scroll 91 begins

**Collating the Three Ancient Textual Methods, Number One Hundred Thirty-Two**

This is the *Book of Questions to the Celestial Master*, which collates and examines the writings of sages and worthies from the opening of Heaven and Earth onward—texts such as the *River Chart*, the *Luo Script*, and divine writings—along with the words of common folk, even those of servants and slaves, and the distant utterances of barbarians. All receive their extraordinary sayings and unique strategies, uniting them into a single discourse to illuminate the Dao of Heaven.

Was this not burdensome?

No.

Because distant matters were cumbersome and inaccessible, each was thus made to seek the abode of Great Peace within their own domain—within their respective towns and villages—so that those too far away to reach it themselves might be provided for. Therefore, abodes were established along the Way, allowing them to deposit unusual words, excellent and rare strategies, and singular methods within.

Thereupon, the central affairs were gathered and held, then delivered to the virtuous ruler above, commanding his assembled ministers to jointly assess and categorize them. The foremost and finest were selected, their heterodox words removed, to form the *Scripture of the Utmost Cavern*, named *The Governance of the Heavenly Utmost Cavern*. Thereafter, the afflictions of Heaven and Earth would be entirely dispelled; the governance of emperors and kings would attain singular great peace; and the accumulated calamities and hardships of ten thousand generations would be wholly eradicated.

Then, the myriad things and host of spirits would have not a single grievance to speak of, and no longer would they report human transgressions to the heavens above.

Thus, the decree commanded those who would compile and collate them, for it was Heaven’s mandate that I speak below. Though the task be burdensome, how could one not exert every effort? The long-standing records of the world and the words of its people each spoke in part—some tenfold, some manifold—yet the doubts of all under Heaven would dissolve of themselves, and no great vexation would remain. Let each remain in their place and speak, then deliver their words upward. This is called gathering the long-accumulated sayings of the world into discourse, to penetrate the intent of Heaven and Earth, to circulate the qi of Heaven and Earth, to dispel the disasters afflicting emperors and kings, and to benefit the common people and the myriad things, so that none fail to find their proper place.

Thereafter, Heaven and Earth would be wholly and greatly pleased; their afflictions wholly dispelled, their joy would then protect the emperors and kings, allowing them to wander at leisure without care.

I wish to ask: Why did Heaven and Earth at this time command the people of the world to jointly assemble their words and strategies, along with the writings of ancient and modern divine sages, to form the *Scripture of the Utmost Cavern*?

Excellent is your question. Indeed, Heaven and Earth suffer from grievous disorder and illness, having never yet received proper governance. Thus, they instructed humanity to gather in counsel and together produce upright words and singular strategies to cure their afflictions. Therefore, they caused this great assembly of words and affairs.

I humbly ask: If Heaven and Earth are in chaos and suffer grievous illness, why do they not instead bring forth a new sage?

What use would it be to force the birth of a later sage? Alas, Perfected One, how foolish you are! I have heard this said before.

The lowly and benighted, born in darkness, accumulate folly and stubbornness, unable to perceive with clarity. Even you, Perfected One, speak thus—how then could the common people possibly understand? If they were to misplace my words and grow ever more resentful, celestial disasters and harms would arise all the greater, beyond all remedy. Thus, Heaven has caused you to ask these repeated questions. Do you wish me to speak at length and explain in full?

Very well, very well. I have witnessed this commission firsthand, and for this matter I descended—dare I conceal or defy Heaven’s will in anger? Go now, Perfected One, listen closely. For you, I shall set forth the principles and resolve them, expounding fully from beginning to end. Simply sit at ease.

Yes, yes.

Now then, the sages of past and present differ in excellence, each excelling in one domain. All speak the words of Heaven and Earth, yet their works vary widely. Thus, the many sages who have appeared before and after each act differently. All delight in aligning with the will of Heaven and Earth, casting off evil and bringing forth goodness, yet their words are not entirely the same—some align, some do not, though they resemble one another in broad strokes. Therefore, the multitude of sages cannot fully grasp the intent of Heaven and Earth, and so Heaven and Earth remain afflicted with grievous illness, not wholly cured. To bring forth another sage would only repeat this cycle, leaving Heaven long disheartened. Thus, I was sent down to set forth these words and inform you, Perfected One. The reason I address you is this: among all the spirits above Heaven, only you, Perfected One, among those below, delight in goodness and seek to accord with Heaven’s heart. Therefore, I convey these words in earnest to you—I do not speak empty words. Do you understand this yourself?

Yes, yes.

Good, you have understood. Now, the reason for collating and comparing the divine writings of high antiquity, middle antiquity, and later antiquity is this: what the divine writings of high antiquity did not address, the divine writings of later antiquity may have spoken of. By arranging them according to kind, supplementing one another, they together form a single, excellent discourse. Thus, they are assembled, and only afterward can the intent of Heaven and Earth in the divine scriptures be discerned. Do you understand this?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have understood.

Go, what the sages of high antiquity lost, the sages of middle antiquity gained; what the sages of middle antiquity lost, the sages of later antiquity gained; what the sages of later antiquity lost, the sages of high antiquity gained. Arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse of the sages. Do you understand this, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

Go, you may be said to have greatly understood.

Go, what the great sages may have lost, the middle sages gained; what the middle sages lost, the lesser sages gained. Again arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse of the sages. Do you understand this?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have understood.

Go, what the greatly virtuous lost, the middling virtuous gained; what the middling virtuous lost, the lesser virtuous gained. Arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse of the virtuous. Do you understand this, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have greatly understood.

Go, what the emperors and kings lost, their ministers and sons gained; what the ministers and sons lost, the common people gained. Arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse. Do you understand this?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have greatly understood.

Go, what the elders lost, the strong in their prime gained; what the strong in their prime lost, the young gained. Arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse. Do you understand this, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have understood.

Go, what men lost, women gained; what women lost, slaves and barbarians gained. Arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse. Do you understand this?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have now known it.

Go, what was lost in the literature of high antiquity, the literature of middle antiquity gained; what was lost in the literature of middle antiquity, the literature of low antiquity gained. Arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse. Do you understand this, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have greatly understood.

Go, what the people of high antiquity lost, the people of middle antiquity gained; what the people of middle antiquity lost, the people of low antiquity gained. Arranged according to kind and supplementing one another, together they form a single, excellent discourse. Do you understand this?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have understood.

Go, sometimes the upper lost it while the lower gained it; sometimes the lower lost it while the upper gained it; sometimes both upper and lower lost it while the middle gained it; sometimes the middle lost it while both upper and lower gained it. Sometimes the celestial spirits’ writings lost it, yet the sagely writings gained it; sometimes the sagely writings lost it, yet the writings of the worthy gained it; sometimes the writings of the worthy lost it, yet the common people’s writings gained it; sometimes the common people’s writings lost it, yet the barbarians gained it. Sometimes the inner lost it, yet the outer gained it; sometimes the outer lost it, yet the inner gained it. Wherever there is loss, there is also gain.

Thus, from high and low, outer and inner, noble and base, distant and near, gather all their writings and essential sayings, collect their long and short passages, and arrange them by kind to supplement one another—then all is complete. Only then are the written records and spoken words wholly interconnected and fully possessed.

Do you understand this, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have now known it.

Heaven and Earth give birth to all things, to people, sages, worthies, and the myriad creatures—each has its strengths and weaknesses, each has what it lacks, each has what it loses. Thus, what they do and make differs, yet in their great essentials, all desire to attain the heart-mind of Heaven and Earth and find peace. At the time, each speaks of what it does as right, each takes its own as true, yet all stray from the heart-mind of Heaven and Earth. Hence, there is always an excess of calamity and harm, now great, now small, flowing ceaselessly—this is the clear proof.

Thus arises the burden of inherited responsibility, and the suffering of later generations grows ever more severe.

Do you understand this, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

Go, you have now understood.

Thus, today Heaven has sent me down to re-examine the teachings of the scriptures for the Supreme Virtue Dao Lord, and I have assembled them all. From the words of divine texts and sagely worthies down to commoners, servants, and barbarians, I have classified them by category, gathering the good from their sayings to form the *Dongji* Scripture, named *The Writ of August Heaven’s Governance of the Utmost Extremity*. Thereafter, all the ailments of Heaven and Earth will be entirely eradicated.

Do you understand this, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

Excellent, excellent! Go, Perfected One, you have now awakened to the arising of affairs and have known it.

Heaven has granted you longevity and raised you to the rank of Supreme Perfected One.

I dare not, I dare not.

You have attained this through your own conduct; it is not by my power. You have done good, unmatched under Heaven, and so Heaven cherishes you.

I dare not, I dare not. This foolish one merely refrains from resenting Heaven—nothing more can be hoped for.

It is no deception.

Yes, yes.

I ask: in assembling these categories to follow one another, I wish to hear the essential meaning.

Good indeed! Your question is profound—has Heaven moved your lips to ask it?

Very well.

Sit at ease, and I will distinguish and explain it for you.

Yes, yes.

Go—suppose we take the character *jia* as an example: it represents one matter. When presented before the assembly of wise and enlightened ones, it is fitting that all under Heaven’s written words and the sayings of the multitude be considered. Among these, there are flawless texts and flawless words. We take the best of these, those that harmonize with the hearts of the people, and gather the foremost explanations, verifying and illuminating them. What arises in accord with the people’s hearts is also in accord with the heart of Heaven and Earth.

How is this made clear? I wish to hear the essential point.

Now, when people act, if their conduct is examined in their own hearts and aligns with the hearts of the multitude of sages and worthies, and all call it good, then its response will immediately accord with the heart of Heaven. If, when examined in one’s own heart, there is doubt, and when examined in the hearts of the multitude of sages and worthies—down to the hearts of petty people—it is called wrong, then it is inauspicious. Heaven will indeed respond to it with misfortune. This is the clear proof.

Thus, we compile these sayings into a scripture: what harmonizes with the hearts of the people is right; what does not is wrong.

Do you understand?

Yes, yes.

Go—all written texts and affairs have their roots. We follow these roots, aligning them with the words of the multitude of scholars, and together we explain them in this way. What harmonizes with the intentions of the people’s hearts also harmonizes with the spirits; what does not harmonize with the people’s hearts does not harmonize with the spirits.

Excellent, excellent! I have heard the command.

Perfected One, why do you speak of having heard the command?

When one acts with good and upright conduct, one gains the heart of Heaven and lives. When one acts wickedly and loses the heart of Heaven, misfortune and death follow. Life and death belong to the decree of fate—hence, I speak of having heard the command.

Excellent! What the Perfected One says is true; I have nothing to add.

Thus, when Heaven rectifies one’s words and texts, there is good fortune; when it does not, there is misfortune. Therefore, I instruct the Perfected One to collate and examine them.

Yes, yes.

Thereafter, the qi of the Great Peace and Supreme August One will arise, and longevity will come forth. Yet even the words of Heaven’s texts and sagely ones have their shortcomings. Thus, the qi of the Supreme August One has been imprisoned by perverse sayings and misleading words and has never been able to come forth.

Since the later opening of Heaven and Earth, the qi of the Supreme August One has never come to assist the emperors and kings in their governance.

Today, Heaven wishes to fully bring it forth, and so it collates and examines the written texts.

For every perverse word, there remains one ailment; for every perverse saying or misleading text, there remains one ailment. Ten perverse words leave ten ailments; a hundred leave a hundred; a thousand leave a thousand; ten thousand leave ten thousand. The ailments follow these remaining perverse words, perverse texts, and misleading sayings.

Heaven is afflicted by these ailments, and so it causes people to be afflicted as well. When people are without ailment, Heaven is without ailment. When half the people are afflicted, half of Heaven is afflicted. When all people, great and small, are afflicted, Heaven is entirely afflicted.

Thus, when people are made to suffer ailments, it is to awaken them—but they do not awaken, and so countless deaths follow.

I wish to hear: how do perverse words, perverse sayings, and perverse texts cause Heaven to be afflicted?

Alas! Why have you again sunk into darkness and ignorance?

Go, sit at ease, and I will explain it to you, Perfected One.

When perverse words and perverse texts are used to expound the scriptures and the Dao, they disorder the scriptures of the Dao. When the scriptures of the Dao are disordered, the patterns of Heaven and Earth are disordered. When the patterns of Heaven and Earth are disordered, Heaven and Earth are afflicted.

Thus, the Three Luminaries, winds and rains, the four seasons, and the Five Phases contend without constancy. The year becomes inauspicious, and the emperor is beset with sorrow and hardship. The officials govern in chaos, and the people suffer resentment, hunger, and cold—is this not the affliction caused by perverse texts and perverse words? If widely employed, it leads to great disorder and ungovernability.

Do you understand?

Yes, yes.

When perverse texts, perverse words, and misleading sayings are used to govern the state, day by day it falls into disorder. Thus, perverse words, perverse sayings, and misleading texts deceive the ears of all, and the state is thrown into chaos and peril. Ministers distort the law and act recklessly; the people are impoverished and destitute. Together, they pollute the governance of Heaven and Earth.

The heavenly officials are enraged, and their teachings are never-ending. The people weep and cry out in grievance, and this too never ends.

Do you understand?

Yes, yes.

When perverse words, perverse texts, and misleading sayings are used to govern the household, fathers and sons, husbands and wives fall into disorder, constantly hating and resenting one another, their quarrels and disputes never ceasing—thus it becomes a household of misfortune.

Do you understand?

Yes, yes.

How dreadful! Hearing the words of the Heavenly Master fills one with terror and alarm. I, foolish as I am, did not deeply consider this and did not realize that such evil brings about these consequences. Truly, I have been ignorant for far too long. The common people regard it as a trivial matter and do not remove it, yet they do not know that these perverse words, perverse sayings, and perverse texts are the great enemies of Heaven and Earth, the great thieves of the state, and the fierce ghosts of the hundred clans. How can they not be entirely cast aside and strenuously eliminated?

Thus, Heaven cherishes rulers of supreme virtue and, fearing they may not awaken, sends down these great calamities. Therefore, I have been sent to explain this in full. True One, swiftly commit these words to writing and disseminate them, so that they may urgently ponder the will of Heaven and thereby secure their own peace. Otherwise, Heaven’s wrath will never cease.

Hence, Heaven no longer relies solely on the words of sages, for they alone cannot entirely eradicate this affliction. Therefore, it commands the people of the world to speak with one voice and collectively examine the ancient texts. Now, Heaven’s indignation and accumulated resentment are directed at these perverse words, perverse texts, and the solitary, flattering, and deceptive sayings.

If you, True One, wish to understand this, consider how when the emperor is enraged and the barbarians repeatedly harm the people, he dispatches millions of soldiers to strike them—this is not done out of mere anger. The greater the anger, the greater the rewards for merit. If the emperor is not enraged, he will once more investigate. Now, Heaven investigates perverse texts in this same manner.

Do you understand?

Yes, yes.

How fearful! The world is now set right. You, True One, may be said to have understood.

Now, these solitary sayings—when even a single person utters perverse words, perverse texts, or perverse sayings—Heaven and Earth regard them as a great enemy, the great thieves of the emperor. The foundation of governance is unsettled, and all falls into chaos thereby.

Therefore, now sever them entirely. Let all gather their words, gather their sayings, and submit their writings to determine matters of peace and stability. Then, the qi of Heaven will daily and entirely find its proper place, and perverse words, perverse sayings will daily and entirely be cut off and extinguished. From this day forward, Heaven will command people to investigate them, and the spirits will also proceed to investigate them. There will be no day of respite, no moment of slackening.

Do you understand?

Yes, yes.

The foolish one is deeply troubled. Since you understand, there should be no need for further examination together. Yes, yes.

The foolish one falls short in every matter, bearing grave transgressions before Heaven and Earth, causing the Heavenly Master concern. Having now witnessed these perverse texts and perverse sayings—the warnings of even a single person—I wish to receive your stern admonitions once more, to the utmost clarity of true scripture’s deepest cautions.

Excellent. The written word has already been compared to speech. Why do you still question this yourself?

The benighted, their hearts bound fast, even the wise cannot fathom. Without repeated clarification and stern instruction, they remain shrouded in darkness, confounding the Heavenly Master’s Dao. Thus, I dare not but ask again.

Excellent are your words. Very well. Be seated, and I shall explain fully for all the assembled Perfected Ones.

True speech, true texts, true sayings—these are the root of the proper ordering of Heaven and Earth, the treasured vessel and parents of the state’s peace, the very mandate by which all people and the myriad things receive their lives. Therefore, one must strive with all one’s strength to set them right.

Yes, yes.

I wish to hear how true speech, true texts, and true sayings serve as the root of Heaven and Earth, the state’s treasured vessel, and the decisive mandate for all people and the myriad things.

Ah! Perfected One, you have heard these words time and again. In my writings, all is afflicted by the sickness of frivolous and perverse speech. Why do you now question this again?

The foolish one follows the common ways, mired in ignorance for so long that I know not where perversity ends. Without repeated, clear admonitions, I remain utterly lost.

If you truly wish to know the truth of this: when common people all speak of goodness and strive together to practice it, yet disasters are not averted, it is because perverse texts and perverse speech have caused the chaos. When common people say, “This will suffice,” yet cannot achieve goodness, but by adhering to it, they instead align with Heaven, and disasters daily recede—this is the work of true texts, true speech, and true sayings. Inwardly, they alone resonate with Heaven, bearing the clear proof of Heaven and Earth’s intent.

Thus, true speech and true texts reveal the very heart of the proper ordering of Heaven and Earth. When all speech is true, all texts are true, all sayings are true, and the emperor enacts them, extending to the humblest people—none fail to delight in practicing what is right. Heaven and Earth are thereby greatly set right. The four seasons, the five phases, and the myriad things—all at once find their proper place. Sun, moon, and the three luminaries keep to their courses, each attaining its proper measure. The state enjoys great peace without care, and even the spirits bestow the elixir of agelessness, while wondrous signs and good omens all emerge. Treachery, deceit, and malevolent omens all perish utterly. The common people each secure their households and fulfill their natural lifespans. The myriad things all attain long life and completion, each in its proper season.

This is the manifest efficacy of true speech, true texts, and true sayings—as the root of Heaven and Earth, the state’s treasured vessel, the parents of the people, the mandate of the myriad things. Do you understand, Perfected One?

Yes, yes.

How wondrous! How wondrous indeed!
The root of Heaven and Earth, the state’s treasured vessel—its mandate rests here.

Perfected One, you may be called one who understands the workings of life, for you have grasped this truth. Therefore, Heaven sent me down to thoroughly examine and rectify it.

Since the opening of Heaven and Earth, those who practice the true Way, speak true words, and compose true texts—Heaven and Earth have ever rejoiced in them greatly, and thus they are ever blessed with good fortune. Those who practice the perverse, speak perverse words, and compose perverse texts—Heaven and Earth have ever been enraged and displeased by them, and thus they are ever beset by misfortune, peril, and ruin.

The common people do not recognize this as the great affliction of Heaven and Earth, the disorder of the emperor’s governance. Yet the most benighted scholars, in their cunning, compose writings below, propagating perverse words and perverse texts, vying to outdo one another, deceiving their superiors, defiling Heaven’s true Dharma, and disrupting Heaven’s true rites. This is the great resentment of Heaven, the great fault of Earth, and the great treachery against the state.

Now, having incurred the resentment of Heaven, the fault of Earth, and the treachery against the state, they yet persist in such deeds daily—how could governance ever be at peace? Today, the Celestial Master condemns these perverse words and perverse texts—how severe is their single transgression!

Alas, Perfected One, are you not foolish?
When people together propagate perverse words and perverse texts, jointly disordering Heaven and Earth, Heaven and Earth are thus ever afflicted—is this not the resentment of Heaven and the fault of Earth? It is like one who constantly harms others—would others not resent and fault them?

Yes, yes.
Thus, the resentment of Heaven and the fault of Earth are made clear.

Now, perverse words, perverse texts, and perverse sayings have already deceived their superiors and endangered the state. Their governance constantly loses the favor of Heaven, their years and lifespans do not increase, and those who bring about their ruin are many, not merely one or two—is this not the great disgrace of the state?

Do you, all Perfected Ones, understand this?
Yes, yes.

People of later ages are often foolish. Some, upon seeing celestial patterns, speak contrary to these words—this is nothing less than the chief of state traitors, the great resentment of Heaven and fault of Earth, the great harm to the people, and the baleful spirits of the myriad things.

Virtuous ruler, be cautious and never heed such words. Those who follow them incur Heaven’s resentment and deviate from the true Way. You must deeply consider the long term, ponder their calamities and harms, to secure lasting peace for yourself.

Heaven has uniquely favored the virtuous ruler, thus crafting these teachings—so that you may secure yourself and protect the state.

Do you understand, Perfected One?
Yes, yes.

Proceed, for you have now greatly awakened.
Be vigilant, be vigilant—Heaven’s majesty must not be transgressed.
Yes, yes.

Let this warning be heeded by all Perfected Ones: from this point onward, the virtuous ruler must carefully examine and ponder the celestial teachings and celestial patterns. When petitions from the three ranks of officials and commoners converge in memorials, by the eighth month, gather and review them, then divide and assign them into three sections.

The first review shall take place to the ruler’s east, where one copy is made. It shall then be passed for a second review to the ruler’s south, and a third copy made. From there, it shall be passed for a third review to the ruler’s west, where the third copy is made. After the third review, the documents shall be discarded to the ruler’s north.

Each review takes place in a separate location, and they must not coincide in time. Why is this?
We wish to hear the reason.
Indeed, if they were to observe one another, deceit might arise—some may conceal flaws or fabricate falsehoods, thus repeating the same deception. This would once more incur the resentment of Heaven and Earth, becoming the state’s greatest traitor.

Heaven and Earth detest such men, yet they employ emperors and kings to govern disorder. Therefore, they separate the reviews into three distinct places, ensuring that the three reviews collectively verify the truth. This is to resolve Heaven’s intent and secure the governance of the kingly ruler.

Why must the first review begin to the ruler’s east?
The east is where Heaven’s qi holds intention and benevolence. Those who review the source of affairs must apply careful thought, diligent effort, and benevolence to align with Heaven and Earth, ever mindful of bringing peace to the emperor and king. Thus, the review begins in the east.

Benevolence is to be enacted, and so one must scrutinize clearly—hence the transmission to the ruler’s south. After clear scrutiny, one must judge and eliminate with righteousness. Those with merit shall have their merits recorded; those without merit shall have their lack of merit recorded, forming the basis of their conduct.

The final records shall be stored in the ruler’s north, placed in a secluded chamber. Thus, the conduct of all under Heaven is known, and the distinction between good and evil is never lost.

Therefore, when the virtuous ruler acts accordingly, he is called a great divine person, fully seated in knowledge of the hearts of all under Heaven and all changes and movements of anomalies.
Do you understand, Perfected One?
How profound! How profound!
You who know reverence for Heaven’s discourse shall long endure.

"Yes, yes. From this point onward, local officials no longer need to report conduct records—conduct is now manifest in these records, and they shall serve as the basis for all accounts. Thus, the virtuous ruler may rest his head upon his pillow in peace, without worry. Do you understand this, Perfected One?"

"Yes, yes. The Celestial Mandate commands the verification of documents: should one matter be omitted, thirty lashes shall be administered; for ten matters, three hundred lashes; for a hundred matters, three thousand. The virtuous ruler shall dismiss such a person, barring them from office forever. This individual treats affairs with reckless disregard—such is the resentment of Heaven and the blame of Earth, the great traitor to the state. Resentment and treachery cannot long be tolerated; they will surely provoke Heaven and Earth, and so must be swiftly removed."

"Excellent! Excellent! Let this be the great admonition to the Perfected One: my written Dao is that which flows from above to below without end. Those who cherish upright speech, upright words, and upright texts—I shall receive the profound charge of Heaven and descend. Truly, I know Heaven cherishes upright speech, upright words, and upright texts, and thus detests with great urgency perverse speech, perverse words, and perverse texts. Heaven and Earth know well their deep resentment, and by this charge they send me down to verify, to expel this resentment and treachery, to pacify the state of virtue and power, and to dissolve the accumulated karmic retributions since the opening of Heaven and Earth. Thus, all harm shall depart and rest be attained, allowing the upright qi to advance and govern fully. Only then shall the six directions, the eight distant realms, and the level qi of August Heaven all arrive in a single moment. Do you understand this, Perfected One?"

"Yes, yes. Therefore, my texts are the pure words of Heaven, never deviating from their singular allotment. Heaven detests perverse texts, and so I detest them; Heaven cherishes upright texts, and so I cherish them. Thus, in my practice of the Dao, I wholly uphold the root and guard the center, casting aside the branches. Heaven upholds the root, and so I uphold the root; Heaven guards the center, and so I guard the center; Heaven casts aside the branches, and so I cast aside the branches.

My texts are thus of one body with Heaven and Earth, one heart and one intent, one allotment and one principle, one love and one hate, one Dao and one path. Therefore, when a virtuous ruler applies them, there is not a single error. For ten thousand myriad years they cannot be abandoned—there is only the bright illumination of the sun, never a time of darkness; only the order of the sun, never a time of chaos; only the goodness of the sun, never a time of evil; only the fortune of the sun, never a time of misfortune. Thus, it is called the Perfectly Penetrating Upright Dao of Heaven, embracing the heart of Heaven and Earth.

Those who attain its highest secret may enjoy long life; those who attain its middle secret become pillars of the state; those who attain its lowest secret may always dwell in peace. Go now—my words are briefly concluded. If you have doubts, return again to ask."

"May I ask: if one inadvertently omits or errs in a matter, should they receive thirty strokes of the rod as proper punishment?"

Excellent is your question. Did Heaven prompt your words?

Indeed, numbers begin with one and conclude at ten. This error of omission in one matter thus concerns the very root of the question of one. Omission and error, if not truthful, become deceit—then they become Heaven’s resentment and Earth’s reproach, the great thieves of the state.

Ten strokes are to make amends to Earth; ten strokes are to make amends to the Emperor and the Kings. Heaven, Earth, and humanity each receive ten, totaling thirty. These strokes serve to atone for the transgression, to dissolve Heaven’s resentment and Earth’s reproach, and to absolve the offense against the Emperor and the Kings. Thus, Heaven and Earth rejoice, and the spirits and deities cease their wrath.

The reason Heaven and Earth are often in turmoil and the spirits and deities grow wrathful lies fundamentally in the failure to verify documents and the prevalence of careless, erroneous speech among people—hence the arising of these calamities and the burden of inherited misfortune. If such carelessness persists, then punishment by the rod is warranted, not because of personal favor, but to rectify the matter.

Now, having convened to deliberate, if the facts are thoroughly examined and the upper record is confirmed, it shall be marked as correct above. If the lower record is likewise confirmed, it shall be marked as correct below. Thus, both upper and lower are deemed true. If only the lower is confirmed while the upper remains unverified, it is of no benefit. If only the upper is confirmed while the lower remains unverified, it is likewise of no benefit. Only when both upper and lower are verified is Heaven’s qi balanced.

If the lower is true but the upper is not, the upper wrongs the lower, and the lower, though innocent, finds its efforts toward goodness futile—Heaven’s wrath arises again. If the upper is true but the lower is not, the lower wrongs the upper—Earth’s wrath arises again. Only when both upper and lower are entirely verified, yet the Emperor and the Kings fail to govern with impartiality, do the spirits of the four seasons, five phases, six relations, and the qi of the six ancestral temples grow restless, and inharmonious qi stirs once more.

Even if one strives to circulate documents through the three Dao, rectifying the words and writings of the world, if one does not govern with diligence, such efforts are in vain. Therefore, I, in accordance with the heart of Heaven, enact transformation for the August Virtuous Ruler, daring not to lose Heaven’s intent. Thus, I fully adhere to Heaven’s law, taking the images of Heaven and Earth as the warp, following the yang as the standard, and aligning with the four seasons and five phases as the ordinance—unchanging for ten thousand generations.

Do you understand?

Indeed.

This humble student has awakened with reverence and holds Heaven’s law in great awe.

Knowing such awe, you are already destined for great fortune. This is a crucial admonition for the Perfected One.

Regarding the method of verifying documents: do not merely speak of their divine script, but examine their written content. If one asserts that such-and-such is true, this is called "deaf script." Does speech alone lack a foundation? How can one claim thus?"

Do not forbid their existence. Rather, inquire into the meaning of their words—only when you grasp their intent can matters be made clear. If one does not explain the meaning, how can understanding be attained? Thus, one must ask for the resolution of their intent; otherwise, they cannot be employed—this is called "deaf governance."

Do you wish to delight in knowing their intent? It is like human speech, which must have a foundation, a source from which it arises. One cannot merely say, "Eastern Lord so-and-so spoke thus to establish matters." Those who verify and establish matters all have a basis—how can they idly fabricate empty words? Therefore, in all matters, one must rely on actual evidence to establish them.

Do you wish to know their great efficacy and clear proof? Consider how I, for the Virtuous Ruler, established transformative laws—all were tested and found responsive, serving as proof of their words. If enacted and unresponsive, they are false words; if enacted and unresponsive, they are contrary to Heaven. Truly, written words and speech are like this—how can one idly establish proof and speak without explanation?

Foolish people may stubbornly cling, asking, "Why are the divine scriptures and words like this?" They are merely words to resolve difficulties and rebut exhaustion. What grandeur do divine scriptures possess? They may have intent, but merely transmitting their words does not reside in a single volume. Transmitted alone, explained from afar, people do not deeply grasp their essential meaning, instead using them only to rebut difficulties and rescue exhaustion, saying, "Eastern Lord spoke thus for so long," to justify themselves—this is truly not so. All have lost the meaning of the explanation.

Thus, the words of the Dao and virtue cannot be thoroughly understood—all because of this. Do you understand?

Indeed.

This humble student has awakened with reverence.

Yet if you had not awakened thus, you would remain deluded. Therefore, when examining my writings, scrutinizing texts and human words, always inquire into their intent. How can one grasp their explanations? By gathering them according to their kind. Only then, when all under Heaven’s texts and words are thoroughly investigated, can the laws of Heaven’s Dao be perceived, and the words of good and evil be understood.

Excellent, excellent! Proceed—my Dao is revealed herein. Perfected One, reflect upon this from beginning to end, mutually verifying and clarifying, and nothing will remain unresolved. All matters under Heaven will be complete, the Great Dao attained, Heaven and Earth pleased, and the Virtuous Ruler eternally secure. All under Heaven will speak with one voice, saying, "Excellent!" No longer will they speak of Heaven’s governance, for they will have regained the intent of Heaven and Earth—thus, it is called peace. When all matters align with the hearts of ordinary people, all under Heaven will have nothing more to say.

Perfected One, do you understand?

Indeed.

If, in practice, minor discrepancies or doubts arise, return to ask again.

Indeed.

Here ends the *Wondrous Scripture on Establishing the Utmost Extreme of Heaven’s Resentment, Earth’s Blame, and the Nation’s Calamity*, *The Scripture of Great Peace*, Scroll Ninety-One.
*The Scripture of Great Peace*, Scroll Ninety-Two.

**The Three Luminaries’ Eclipses: Scroll One Hundred Thirty-Three**

Someone asked: Why do the Three Luminaries of Heaven sometimes suffer eclipses?

Excellent, this question of yours. These are the great resentments of Heaven and Earth—when Heaven and Earth engage in unseen struggle, their signs manifest in the sun, moon, and stars. Thus, eclipses may occur, or they may not; the fault lies in the clash of yin and yang qi.

Why do they clash?

Yin and yang deceive each other, vying for dominance. By nature, yin and yang should alternately aid and protect one another, together forming harmonious qi. Yet they turn to struggle—all fault lies in this disharmony.

If they were harmonious, would there be no eclipses?

Indeed. In the most virtuous eras of remote antiquity, eclipses never occurred. But as later generations increasingly lost the intent of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang gradually ceased to cherish one another, leading to their struggle.

If you doubt my words, let the Virtuous Ruler examine and practice my teachings. When their full meaning is grasped, the struggle will cease; when partially understood, it will partially cease; when half-grasped, it will half cease. Without diligent practice, the distress will persist.

Someone asked: When do the sun and moon eclipse—what celestial movements cause their convergence?

Alas, how foolish you are! Perfected One, you risk provoking Heaven’s wrath again. How do you presume to know of "celestial movements"?

This foolish student observes their conjunction.

How profoundly benighted your mind is—how utterly dark! If we follow your reasoning, it is merely a matter of celestial movements converging.

Then why, within a single year, do the sun and moon eclipse without respite? Or why, for years on end, do they not eclipse at all? How do celestial movements explain this? When the Emperor’s virtue flourishes, the sun and moon do not eclipse, and the stars do not fall into disorder—how do celestial movements account for this?

Moreover, yin and yang naturally coexist and should cherish one another—why do they harm each other instead? By nature, they should alternately generate and complete one another—why do they turn to mutual destruction?

You are truly foolish. If you wish to know the truth, consider the analogy of people. When those who have long been close meet after a long separation, their joy is boundless—they aid, benefit, praise, and honor one another. But when those who have never been close suddenly meet, they fight at once. If the enmity is great, they fight to the death; if slight, they brawl briefly.

How terrifying! How terrifying!

This foolish student now understands.

Pray, I ask: the sun is the essence of fire, belonging to yang, while the moon is the essence of water, belonging to yin. Now, water and fire do not share the same dwelling—when they meet by chance, they extinguish each other. What does this mean? Are they not akin?

Excellent! Your words grasp the intent. Yet water and fire, each following their own Dao and abiding by their course, may harmonize and together establish merit and accomplish deeds—just as the Five Phases cannot lack a single one, for they alternately generate and complete one another. If you wish to know the truth of this, consider the Five Viscera dwelling together within the human abdomen. The heart is fire, the kidneys are water—how could they share the same place yet daily engage in battle and mutual consumption? Do you now understand or not?

Indeed, indeed. This foolish student has awakened.

Thus, when the qi of harmony arrives, the Three Luminaries no longer contend or eclipse. Only when the Three Luminaries do not consume one another can one begin to speak of attaining the heart of Heaven and Earth—this serves as proof. Therefore, if you wish to know your own excellence or deficiency and practice the Dao and virtue, yet fail to observe this celestial evidence, gathering instead a multitude of texts that speak of mutual consumption in shared dwelling—such works merely record the words of mutual affection without deeply grasping their meaning. Even if divine texts exist, Heaven has not yet fully revealed their true essence. Do you understand?

Indeed, indeed. Go forth—you have awakened. After my text is revealed, may virtuous emperors and kings ponder this celestial intent and never forget these words, for they are the means to attain the heart of Heaven. If one aligns with the intent of Heaven, one’s mandate will be long and whole. If one fails to align with Heaven’s intent, the Gate of Mandate falls into chaos. To act without accord with the heart of Heaven is also a great calamity. From the earliest antiquity, the sagely emperors and kings have taken this as their warning, deeply inscribing my words within their hearts, so that subtle words may be seen and the Dao attained. I entrust this to the most virtuous of rulers, to save the Three Luminaries from their battles and eclipses.

Indeed, indeed. Go now. This minor discourse is complete; if doubts remain, return to ask again.

**Secret of the Primordial Fire and Primordial Qi of the Twelve Thousand States, One Hundred Thirty-Fourth**

Pray, I ask: the world shares the same sun and moon, the same Dipper and Pole Star. One great division comprises twelve thousand states, the central division eighty-one domains, further divided into smaller parts, each a single state. Those of superior virtue expand their territory to twelve thousand *li*; next, ten thousand *li*; then nine thousand, eight thousand, seven thousand, six thousand, five thousand, four thousand, three thousand, two thousand, and one thousand *li*. Then five hundred *li*, then one hundred *li*. These mark the lands of middling virtue, where excellence and deficiency manifest in their expansion and preservation. Those of inferior virtue may possess not a single level plot of land, all plagued by afflictions and transformations, causing the sun and moon of a single state to contend and eclipse. Among the twelve thousand states, are they all eclipsed? When the Dipper and Pole Star dim, do all twelve thousand states likewise dim?

Excellent, profound, distant, and subtle—such is your question! Why do you ask specifically about this transformation? If one state experiences change, why should the twelve thousand states all be praised, yet some still undergo transformation? I feared that without the Celestial Master’s inquiry, this would remain unknown through all ages—thus I ask.

Excellent! Your doubt truly enters the Dao. When one state undergoes change, only that state’s sun dims, called an eclipse. Neighboring states may witness it from afar, but distant states remain uneclipsed. When the Dipper and all stars dim, only those that have lost Heaven’s intent grow dim, while distant ones remain uneclipsed. Now I ask: what barrier obscures them, causing them alone to dim?

Alas, you remain as an unopened child, like the common folk! Consider this: Heaven and Earth are vastly distant. In a state that has lost the Dao and lacks virtue, perverse qi rises to obscure and veil the heavens. The Three Luminaries, each following their kind upward, are thus dimmed. It is like a place shrouded in mist—there, the Three Luminaries alone grow dim, while mistless places remain brightly lit. If you wish to know further, consider how in yin places only the moon’s eclipse is unseen, while in yang places only the sun’s eclipse is seen. If you wish to know the truth of this, consider this year when Jupiter resides in *Zi*: virtuous states alone enjoy prosperity, while virtueless states suffer calamity. Though they share the same state and the same year, their fortune and misfortune differ—just as people share the same Heaven and Earth, yet their peace or peril, customs and conditions, vary. Do you understand?

Indeed, indeed.

Excellent indeed, excellent indeed.

Now, the sun and moon course and shine upon the twelve thousand states alike, yet their brightness or dimness differs—this lies in the differing conditions of each place. In states governed by the Dao and virtue, their rule is pure and clear, tranquil and free of perversion; thus their Three Luminaries alone shine brightly, for the perverse yin qi below cannot rise to veil them. Where they are dim, the fault lies below: the people collectively deceive those above, and perverse qi together ascends to obscure what is above.

In states without the Dao, their rule is filthy and turbid, rife with treachery and deceit, self-shrouded and self-concealed—thus their Three Luminaries grow dim. If you wish to know this truth more deeply, consider how it is like squinting at the sun versus gazing at it with eyes wide open; or like gazing at the sun with eyes fully open versus peering at it through a thin veil of silk—this is precisely the case. Do you understand?

Indeed, indeed.

How astonishing, how astonishing! If you grasp this astonishment, you shall attain long life.

Indeed, indeed.

As for those states doomed to misfortune and decline, their Three Luminaries are utterly dimmed. It is like a blind man who alone cannot behold the brightness of the Three Luminaries—the Three Luminaries remain as they are, yet the blind man alone fails to see them. It is like one in the prime of life who alone perceives the brightness of the Three Luminaries, while the aged alone cannot perceive their brightness—this is the effect of their flourishing or decline. Do you fully understand?

Indeed, indeed.

Go forth now.

May I ask: what is the single, absolute teaching? And what, precisely, is this "One" that we do not yet clearly understand?

Ah! A true person clings to texts in excess—why then do you doubt this? Now you are lost in darkness. If you grasp the guarding of the One, all matters are complete—why do you still ask such trifling questions? You ought to ponder these words.

Indeed, indeed.

The One is the heart, the mind, the will. It is the spirit dwelling within this body. All affairs under heaven are accomplished through it. From ancient times to the present, the transformations of the worthy and the sagely have all been shaped by this, for they early understood and studied the heart and mind, directing their will toward goodness and preserving virtuous deeds. Fools bring only misfortune upon themselves, for they learn and cling to evil deeds.

The nature of heaven and earth is such that all creatures that crawl and move are thus—therefore, through the teachings of a master, longevity may be attained. What Dao is there to study? Heaven and earth may be grasped. Gathering a multitude of millions is not equal to serving a single worthy person. A multitude of fools, in their millions, can only hasten ruin and defeat.

If you truly guard the body of a single worthy one, what harm can befall you? If you cannot turn back and reflect upon yourself, seeing your thoughts as if gazing into a mirror, then your will directed afar brings illness to the body, withering and decay in all affairs. But if your will is near, the body retains its luster.

All things are accomplished through the will and its intentions—if you do not prepare and remember them, then all affairs under heaven are just so. Do you understand?

Indeed, indeed.

Pray, I ask: when drought and frost cause all to perish, when the people suffer from hunger and cold, perishing in agony—what is this slaying? This is the slaying of August Heaven and the Great Yang, for the Six Yangs are all resentful and thus able to bring harm.

What does this mean? I wish to hear it.

Indeed, when the Six Myriads reach their utmost extreme, their great rigidity all resents humanity’s prolonged disorder and evil, hence the killing. How does this harm people?

It has no name. It merely encounters the extreme of inherited burdens, when Heaven’s wrath erupts, making no distinction between the good and evil of people—those who encounter it meet great misfortune.

Do you wish to know the truth of it? Compare it to a man: when a man is seized by great rage, he may vent his fury upon a good person, not sparing them, but instead harming others at random. Now, what fault have those others committed? Yet they encounter his outburst. Heaven’s wrath erupts in the same way.

Thus, the responsibility of inherited burdens is most severe, causing people to die without distinction between good and evil. The great fault lies here.

Therefore, my scripture follows Heaven’s teaching, now seeking to decisively sever the burden of inherited responsibility. Heaven’s transgressions run deep and heavy, harming many innocent people—Heaven sorely laments this. Thus, it commands me to instruct the Perfected Ones, entrusting this scripture to a ruler of supreme virtue, that wicked, deceitful, and false people may be cut off, and Heaven’s Dao made upright.

Do you understand? Indeed, indeed.

I humbly inquire: since the opening of Heaven and Earth, why have people perished entirely from raging epidemics, or been utterly destroyed by floods, or annihilated by warfare? What transgressions have they committed to deserve such fates? Are these merely the conjunctions of Heaven and Earth? Or are they the calamities of inherited burdens?

Yet in ancient and modern texts, many explain these as the meetings of Heaven and Earth’s yin and yang—this is incorrect. All such disasters are the calamities of inherited burdens.

When Heaven’s qi is in harmony, but its anger arises, and the spirits engage in battle, those who die from raging epidemics are struck down by Heaven’s punishment. Those who perish in floods are struck down by Earth’s punishment. Those who die by warfare are struck down by human punishment.

I wish to understand: why are those who die from raging epidemics killed by Heaven? Heaven governs the spirits and presides over the chiefs of the divine. Thus, it commands the spirits and ghosts to slay people. Earth is the humble aspect of yin, and water is the most intense aspect of yin. That which belongs to Earth’s yin governs the gestation of all things. When gestation is harmed, it must become blood—blood being of the same kind as water. When gestation is harmed, it inevitably stirs anger and displeasure, further spreading its polluted blood to injure others.

Water is the blood and veins of Earth, the yin of Earth. When yin is humbled and enraged, it must engage in battle to kill people. This is like a minister who goes forth to capture bandits, necessarily acting with his own body to apprehend them. He cannot remain like a lord, merely speaking from his place.

The harmonious is humanity, which governs the four seasons and the five phases in shared rule. People should act in harmony and accord, but when they lose the Dao and fail to follow it, their anger arises. Thus, the qi of the four seasons rebels, and the five phases engage in battle, causing people to attack one another. All this stems from Heaven and Earth’s harmonious qi growing angry and displeased, accumulating illness and distress over time, leading to these outcomes.

Excellent! Had you not pressed with such forceful inquiry, there would be no way to know this. I wish to understand: if these are all calamities of inherited burdens, arising from the anger of the three qi, then in times without inherited burdens, how do people die?

People are born with a natural end; the high, the low, and the middling each fulfill their allotted years. Some attain the true Dao and thereby transcend the world—such people bear no fault of inherited burdens, for this is the natural way.

Do you understand? Indeed, indeed.

"Go forth, do you understand? Those who die suddenly in groups—none of this is fate. It is the manifestation of Heaven and Earth’s harmonious qi, the four seasons, and the five phases waging war in wrathful suppression and slaughter. Excellent, excellent! Had you not inquired of the Heavenly Master, there would be no way to know this. Thus, since the opening of Heaven and Earth, such calamities have always existed, yet people remain unaware of them. Now, deeply grieved and anxious over this, seeing many die without guilt, the Supreme moved Heaven, and Heaven thus sent me down to explain it fully. After my celestial texts have been enacted, people and all things will each die according to their allotted lifespan, with no more mass deaths. Excellent, excellent! Future generations will each fulfill their destiny—do you, Perfected One, understand? Indeed, indeed.

May I ask: if death does not follow the cycles of Heaven’s Dao or the revolutions of time, why does disorder always arise at the junctures of Heaven and Earth? Do the five phases clash at their intersections? Do the divine sequences of the Five Emperors reach exhaustion and distress? Ah, excellent—your questioning is profound, Perfected One! Has Heaven now prompted your inquiry? Your words delve into celestial prophecy—what single essential truth lies here? I rejoice greatly in this. Now, if what you say is true, I shall provide a detailed explanation for you. All you Perfected Ones have come from afar to inquire on behalf of Heaven and Earth, to resolve doubts since the opening of Heaven and Earth and the reigns of emperors. You should sit in repose and listen to my words. Indeed, indeed.

Now, the laws of Heaven and the destinies of people and all things..."

Just as the qi of the four seasons ought only to succeed one another in generation and transmission, passing along in turn. Just as in human life, the young will later grow old, alternating and passing along in succession. They ought not engage in Daoist strife and warfare, thereby extinguishing the generations of the world. The reason for Daoist warfare—where floods, droughts, epidemics, and death exhaust all—is that the lord of men, following the former kings and ancestors, gradually loses the mind and intent of the Dao. Over time, this accumulates until the juncture arrives, whereupon he fails to measure himself and thus perishes utterly, leaving no remnant kind. Now, the three norms of Heaven, Earth, and Man rely upon one another to stand and take form through mutual dependence. It is like a person having head, feet, belly, and body—if one norm is destroyed, the three norms all collapse in ruin. If a person lacks head, feet, or belly, and one part is lost, then all three are in peril. Thus, when the great Dao suffers great ruin, the three norms of Heaven and Earth perish, plunging all into darkness and confusion, and the myriad things thereby perish as well. Once things are exhausted, they cannot suddenly regenerate. From this, consider how much is lost, how much is extinguished—sometimes recovery comes swiftly, sometimes great ruin endures for a long time before restoration is possible. Thus, minor destruction allows for swift recovery.

If you wish to know this in greater certainty, so that virtuous lords of later generations may clearly perceive the great effects of Heaven and Earth’s grievances—it is like a household managing its livelihood. Those with abundant stores, though they encounter the misfortune of successive lean years, endure securely. A household with vast reserves, even if it suffers bad harvests for years on end, still survives. A household with modest stores, if it meets successive years of failure, starves to extinction. A perpetually impoverished household, if it meets a single bad year, perishes utterly, unable to measure itself and escape, thus trapped without posterity.

The Dao of Heaven has its fixed laws; its revolutions are not mere junctures of chance. It is like summer and autumn, when one must exert effort to harvest, and winter and spring, when one must live on stored provisions. If summer and autumn do not diligently gather, winter and spring will bring starvation and extinction. The ancient sages, in their celestial writings, thus recorded these junctures. The Perfected One wishes to know it thus.

Now, as the qi of Great Peace arrives, it should remain perpetually balanced, and there ought to be no more junctures of death and extinction. Heaven commands the emperor to govern, and thus awakens the virtuous lord. All the people, in following the Dao and its affairs, must be made to glimpse and awaken to this truth. Had the former generations of common people constantly upheld the essential Dao and essential virtue, even if they encountered such junctures, they would not have perished. The method by which Heaven commands the emperor to govern the state is this: to possess virtue and power is the greatest wealth, while to lack virtue and power is the greatest poverty and distress. Those called "without Dao and without virtue" are those who cannot stabilize Heaven and Earth and thus lose them.

The former generations gradually abandoned and severed virtue and power, accumulating over time until they passed on their burdens to later generations. Those born afterward suffered their grievances, poisons, and calamities, all responding to governance without Dao. When the revolutions reached the point of extinction, they could not extricate themselves—the great fault lies here. Do you understand this?

Indeed, indeed. How dreadful! How dreadful!

Go now, and I shall further enlighten the Perfected One with another teaching.

The Dao and virtue are to humanity as the heart is to Heaven. Just as a person possesses a heart, if the human heart faithfully upholds the Dao, it will constantly dwell in fortune; if the human heart turns to evil and abandons the Dao, it will constantly decline into misfortune. When the spirit of the heart departs, death follows. Thus, when the essential Dao and virtue are severed, people perish, and Heaven and Earth likewise fall into chaos and ruin.

Therefore, the Dao causes Heaven, Earth, and humanity to share the same concerns and the same affairs, enabling them to mutually generate and complete one another. If they do not share the same concerns and affairs, they will refuse to mutually generate and complete one another. They are bound together in mutual concern and mutual benefit, and thus the Dao and virtue link them, making their destinies one.

For this reason, when Heaven and Earth behold people practicing the Dao and virtue in goodness, they rejoice greatly; when they see people doing evil, they grow furious and indignant. Does the Perfected One understand this?

Indeed, indeed. How dreadful! This foolish one greatly fears it.

If you know to fear it, then you may attain long life without misfortune. If you do not know to fear it, then Heaven has already begun to turn away from you. You ought to be deeply cautious.

Indeed, indeed.

Go now, and I shall further enlighten the Perfected One with another explanation.

The course of fortune and misfortune may be likened to the Dao, virtue, ritual propriety, and righteousness on the one hand, and to punishments on the other. If people uphold the Dao, virtue, ritual propriety, and righteousness, then punishments will not arise. If they lose the Dao, virtue, ritual propriety, and righteousness, then punishments will emerge.

Thus, those who uphold the good Dao find the path of misfortune naturally severed; it departs without being taught to leave. Those who follow the path of misfortune find the way of speech naturally cut off. This is like the sun rising and the stars fleeing, or the stars appearing and the sun setting—without the slightest deviation.

Excellent, excellent!

Now I reveal to the Perfected One a great esoteric teaching. The people of this age accumulate ignorance and darkness to an extreme degree, passing down warnings to one another that the cycles of time bring fortune and misfortune. If this is so, what benefit is there in doing good? What harm is there in doing evil? If the cycles of time are natural, what use is there in striving to do good?

Yet those who attain fortune are the sages who constantly align with the heart of Heaven, teaching people to do good—this is correct. Those who speak of cycles of time as reversing and thereby disrupting the Dao of Heaven utter words that cause Heaven and Earth to remain perpetually displeased. It is human conduct that brings this about, yet they blame the cycles of time for turning evil, refusing to acknowledge their own wrongdoing and instead accusing Heaven and Earth of being evil.

This is like a wicked and unfilial child in a household who refuses to admit his own faults and instead accuses his parents of being evil—this is precisely the case. Thus, Heaven is constantly afflicted, seething with anger and resentment. Because of this, the cycles of time bring about their destruction and conflict, delighting in the transformation of their kind.

If this were not so, the old would depart in their time, the young would grow, and each would reach the end of their allotted years and undergo transformation. This is like the changes in human form since the opening of Heaven and Earth.

Excellent! This foolish one has gained a great understanding: though the forms of people past and present differ, their *qi* remains the same.

If you wish to know this in greater depth, consider the *qi* of the four seasons and the positions of the Five Phases. Though their receptions differ, internally they share the same *qi*, mutually generating and completing one another. This is like the head and feet of a person, which do not resemble each other yet internally unite to form a single being.

Excellent, excellent!

Now I shall further enlighten the Perfected One with another teaching.

Heaven has accumulated illness because people do evil and perversely claim that the cycles of time are inauspicious. When the *qi* of the Supreme August arrives, it should assist the virtuous ruler in governance. Yet I fear that the people of this age will not change their conduct, persisting in evil deeds that disrupt the correct *qi*, destroying Heaven’s treasures. Therefore, I have been sent down to produce writings for the virtuous ruler, to enlighten the multitude and cause them to constantly follow my texts in their conduct, no longer troubling Heaven and Earth or violating Heaven’s prohibitions.

From this point onward, practice my celestial texts, and the spirits will assist the virtuous ruler in governance. Those who violate them will be punished; if people do not punish them, the spirits will. Do you understand?

Indeed, indeed. I dare not violate them.

Go now, our discourse is nearly complete. Always reflect on its essentials.

Indeed, indeed.

"May I ask, Heavenly Master, regarding the talismanic strategies for the twelve thousand states—each differing in meaning—where should they be placed? Should each follow its state’s customs, and with what should one begin?"

"Begin with the *qi* of fire in the southeast of the Dipper’s handle."

"I wish to hear the essential meaning of this."

"Fire is yang. Its talisman now governs the heart of Heaven. Harmony governs bestowal, opening governs communication, and clarity governs the management of all affairs. Fire is the heart, and the heart governs the spirit. Harmony may serve as the origin of transformation; all matters that will flourish arise from the heart. The heart governs correct affairs, relying on benevolence to bring illumination, and in turn possesses divine radiance. Though the twelve thousand states’ strategies differ, they are unified in serving as documents for presenting petitions on high. Heaven’s *qi* will naturally follow and circulate—you, Perfected One, must rouse yourself to enact them. Do not oppose this, or you will perish. It is because Heaven delights in issuing these writings that I have been sent to speak. If you do not believe my words, seek verification in your own person. If you practice them, disasters will daily diminish—this is Heaven’s joy in their enactment, and thus disasters recede. If you do not practice them and suffer many illnesses and calamities, it is because Heaven is enraged and grieved, and you obstruct the Dao’s path. Fire is perilous—do not question others about it, but seek proof here, as clear as the sun and moon. Whatever Heaven intends to do, you must not be careless. To fail to act or comply will cause the hearts of people to fall into chaos. Perfected One, be cautious."

"Indeed, indeed."

"Go now, and let me admonish you once more. If Heaven does not wish it done, yet you alone persist, you will invite illness. My texts take this as their verification; from this point onward, it shall always be so. The texts have been reiterated—no further words will be added to complicate them, lest the Dao become difficult to comprehend."

"Indeed, indeed."

"Go, and let me admonish you once more. These disasters and illnesses are not the fault of people of this generation alone—their origins are ancient and distant. Do not seek to eradicate them hastily; simply follow the Heavenly Dao to dissolve and eliminate them. In this way, you will be said to have attained the heart and intent of Heaven. If you do not follow my texts’ instructions and instead impose harsh punishments, disasters will multiply daily, and Heaven will not be pleased. Do you understand, Perfected One?"

"Indeed, indeed."

**"Fire Qi and the Rectification of the Divine Dao, Scroll One Hundred Thirty-Five"**

Someone asked: In ancient times, the Fire Phase once achieved Great Peace, yet the Divine Dao was not rectified. Why does the Heavenly Master now uniquely command the Fire Phase to rectify the Divine Dao?

Excellent, your question! Thus it is: a hundred people have a hundred intentions, a thousand people have a thousand intentions, ten thousand people have ten thousand intentions—each employs different strategies, each diverges from the others, and so most fail to attain the heart and intent of Heaven.

The Perfected One speaks truly.

Now, Fire qi is at its most flourishing, and the qi of the Supreme Sovereign arrives, yet the common follow in its wake. After the Fire Phase achieved the qi of Great Peace in ancient times, there has been nothing like it since the opening of Heaven and Earth.

Why must the Fire qi in its flourishing state rectify the Divine Dao? I wish to hear your intent.

Ah! Fire is the heart of Heaven. The heart governs the spirit; when the heart is rectified, the spirit becomes luminous. Thus Heaven has sent me down to govern the Divine Dao.

Yet the Divine Dao is inherently divine—why must it be governed?
